title: ↕Derivation Path
desc: HD wallet derivation paths — how your seed phrase generates all your addresses.

msgs.text: What is the derivation path of a seed phrase?
https://twitter.com/NEEDcreations/status/1615554388944093185?t=dVuz7IvAwWC5Jntf5tjgRA&s=19
https://twitter.com/satsstackamoto/status/1615555735336931334?t=9_dAyJTQy3RaYmfWsKleAQ&s=19
↕Derivation Path
think of your wallet as a tree.
paths are defined as follows
`m / purpose' / coin_type' / account' / change / address_index`
`m/84'/0'/0'` means that you are using purpose 84 (P2WPKH) and coin 0 (Bitcoin) with account #0.
`m/44'/0'/0'` is almost the same but it's P2PKH.

for `m/84'/0'/0'/0/0` this means
- purpose 84: P2WPKH
- coin 0: Bitcoin
- account 0
- external address
- address #0
and if you replace `m/84'/0'/0'/0/0` with `m/84'/0'/0'/1/0` it's now a change address
also you may be asking what the `'` is for
so if you have the XPUB for any path, like `m/84'/0'/0'`, you can derive anything under it, like `m/84'/0'/0'/0/0`, which allows you to generate an entire list of addresses without the private key.
but you can't generate m/84'/0'/0'/0'
because the `'` means you need the xpriv, the private key, to generate the next key
... and why does this exist?
so, if you leaked the private key of `m/84'/0'/0'/0/0`, you think only that address would be compromised, right... nope.
if you also leak the xpub of `m/84'/0'/0'`, all private keys for addresses under `m/84'/0'/0'` are compromised.
but if you leak `m/84'/0'`'s xpub, they can't compromise `m/84'/0'/0'` with `m/84'/0'/0'`s private key, since they need the private key of `m/84'/0'`.
so if you leak `m/84'/0'/0'`'s xpub and `m/84'/0'/0'/0/0`'s key, they can compromise the following

```
m no, because the one below isn't compromised
 /84' no, because the one below isn't compromised
 /0' no, they hit a hardened derivation path
 /0' yes, anything below is compromised
 /0 yes, anything below is compromised
 /0 - yes
```
Awesome thanks
